ygData.subject: Re: Studs and studded leather armor...
ygData.msgSnippet: That d be great if Reinforced weren t more expensive to make than Banded. Cost on Reinforced is like 6400 for a tunic.  (Assuming you re buying the boning,
ygData.messageBody:
That'd be great if Reinforced weren't more expensive to make than Banded.

Cost on Reinforced is like 6400 for a tunic. (Assuming you're buying the
boning, like most tailors who are skilled enough to take a stab at
reinforced.)

Reinforced is useful to those who cannot wear anything greater than
leather. It's not someything you buy for your Barbarian warrior.

On Sun, 16 May 1999, Jason Coan wrote:

> From: "Jason Coan" <coanj@...>
>
> I've yet to see any either, but it seems like there would be a good market
> for studded and bonned armor for those people who can't quite yet afford
> banded and already have leather....assuming that the AC is actually better.
>
> Salr D'Taynkk
> Dark Warrior of The Kith
> Veeshan
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Derek Cass [mailto:dcass@...]
> > Sent: Saturday, May 15, 1999 9:54 AM
> > To: EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com
> > Subject: [EQ_SMITHS] Studs and studded leather armor...
> >
> >
> > Is it worth making studded leather armor? I have never seen
> > studded leather in any form, and I have seen websites that say
> > studded leather has the same AC as leather, and I have seen sites
> > that say studded leather is between leather and chain. My
> > character Cassin (Povar), is both a tailor and a smith (and not
> > very good at either!), so I was wondering if this would be a
> > smart endeavour.
> >
> >
>
>
